Tutorial.name: Tutorial
Tutorial.FlavourText: Welcome! Let be introduced to the world of Weyard and Golden Sun!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome to the marvelous world of Weyard, aspiring adept. I will introduce you to the setting of Golden Sun and how the mechanics are going to work. If you want to take your time while doing this, you can react with :pause_button: to stop a battle from automatically going forward. To continue, click on the 'Attack' reaction.

Weyard is a world filled with the power of alchemy. This means, that everything consists of the four classical elements.
Venus, the element of Earth,
Mars, the element of Fire,
Jupiter, the element of Wind and
Mercury, the element of Water.
An adept is a human who inherited the power of one of these elements.

As you are an aspiring adept too, you will want to align yourself with one of these elements, if you haven't done so yet. Go to #gabomba-gears and use the command `i!element Venus`, or any other elemental path you would like to pursue. Generally, all commands are to be used in this channel. Note, that you can change your element at any time and as often as you want!

You will see that you have been put into a class. This class determines the your stats and the abilities (the psynergy) you have access too. Furthermore, any given class is either a Warrior or a Mage, which determines the type of equipment you can wield.

Speaking of equipment, the commands for equipment are vast, but simple. They are pinned in both #colosso-talks and #gabomba-gears. Here is some basic gear that you can equip for starters. Open your chests using `i!chest`

At last, let's talk about battles. Bringing a fighters HP to zero puts them down. You can use a variety of different moves, psynergies, including attacks that either target a single enemy or a range, healing moves or status moves. Watch how using psynergy takes up Psynergy Point (PP), the equivalent of Mana. Make sure to have enough to spare to get out of a pinch! Now, try to take down this little critter.

If there are multiple enemies you need to set your target. First select the move you want to use and then use the number icons to target the enemy with that number. In the case of ranged attacks, the selected enemy is the center most enemy which will take most of the damage.

Well done! You are set and ready! You are starting off in the calm town of Vault. It is near the Ruins of Vale, one of the most significant locations to the world of Golden Sun and the perfect place to start off an unforgetable adventure!

RewardTables.message:
Quick summary:
-Use commands in #gabomba-gears.
-Select an element using `i!element Venus` or whichever you want. You can change it at any time.
-Specify a class using `i!class Squire` (from what is available to you).
-Pause a battle by reacting anywhere with :pause_button:. The timer will restart at the beginning of the next turn.
-Don't forget to target your enemy with the numbered icons.

Don't be shy to ask questions in #colosso-talks or find team mates to brawl with!

Vale.name: Vale
Vale.FlavourText: What once was the calm town of Vale. The town has been abandonden and destroyed when the Golden Sun event happened.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Valeans were training hard to protect their village and secrets. As a young adept, you are walking in their footsteps.
A light Storm is coming up, watch out for the critters that have overrun the town since.
The storm gets harsher, more critters attack.
Out of one of the ruined houses, a swarm of bats get's stirred up.
Did you eat something funny? Why are the Mushroom walking!?
Watch out! A boulder is falling from Mount Aleph! You need to dodge it!
The storm appears to calm down, but a few critters are still roaming around.
You camp for the night. You contemplate what an interesting world you're living in and are excited to explore as much of it as possible.

Sol Sanctum.name: Sol Sanctum
Sol Sanctum.FlavourText: The destroyed holy grounds above Vale. Watch out for falling rocks.

Matchups.Flavourtext: The broken down entrance of the Sanctuary is still impressively massive and massively impressive. You enter cautiously...
As the way lights up, some monsters get scared and jump forward
You solve some puzzles to free the way to empty rooms. Well, not *completely* empty, anyways.
You reach a very distinct room. You have heard about it. You see a bunch of statues, but you can only move one. Which one will it be?

You have solved the puzzle, you have reached the ruined Star Chamber! The roof of it has broken down and the room is exposed directly to the Golden Sun. Some nasty looking monsters are looking at you from afar, it would be better to turn back now than never!

On the ledge of the star chambers platform, high above the watery depths, you spot a person, sitting there with crossed legs. Startled by the commotion, the person stands up and slowly walks towards you. 
'Welcome', the purple haired woman said calmly. 'My name is Hama. I like to come here amidst the spirits to meditate. I assume you also came here to learn more about the mystics of Alchemy. Perhaps it's your luck, perhaps it is destiny that our paths have crossed. Let me be your guide in showing you the world!'

Star Chamber.name: Star Chamber
Star Chamber.FlavourText: The mysterious star chamber. Watch out, it's slippery!

Matchups.Flavourtext: What is going on? The Star Chamber appears to be alive! Watchout! Run!
That was close. Look! The guardians of the elemental stars are noticing you!
It appears there's more going on than usual, what is happening? The creatures living in the water are climbing up to you.
You see more djinn in the distance. They appear to be approaching you! Wait a minute, those aren't djinn, they're more of these balls!

From what appears to be water down below, a silhouette can me made out. 'I am the guardian of water. Well, his apprentice. And you have been busting my balls all day, so I'm slowly starting to get fed up'

RewardTables.message: Nice Work, {0}! You beat the greatest dungeon so far! Stay tuned for more!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Well done! You defeated the secret mini super boss!

Vale Cave.name: Vale Cave
Vale Cave.FlavourText: Hidden behind Kraden's Cottage, there is a small cave. Whatever might be in there?

Matchups.Flavourtext: A bear is in the cave. What did you expect.
Wipe off the hair, let's go!
The cave is getting darker and danker.. What will be at the end of it?
'*We need to go deeper*' a voice inside of you whispers, full of curiousity. Another voice tells you that it's probably not worth it.
The cave is getting spooky. You can see a yellow stone glimmering in the back. The voices inside you are in discord whether you should keep going.
Oh hey!
Looks like it was worth it after all! Now let's quickly exit this creepy place...

Vault.name: Vault
Vault.FlavourText: Vault is a small town in the center of Angara. It has become the refuge for a lot of Valeans.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Since the events of the Golden Sun, a lot of Valeans moved to Vault. The amount of monsters around here is making a lot of them reconsider. A guy named Patcher has been talking about setting up shop nearby.
The local cemetery is unsettling a lot of the inhabitants.
The Skeleton's bones have attracted a dog... and wolves! Protect the pup!
The dog is thankful for saving him and giving him a bone, he appears it to wants to show you something [Vault Cave once implemented], but you are distracted by some rats.
You head to the inn. You notice a bunch of thieves preparing a robbery, you need to stop them!
Wow, what a dangerous neighborhood. No wonder the Valeans aren't happy here either. Let's sleep for one more night and then get out of here!

Goma Cave.name: Goma Cave
Goma Cave.FlavourText: A cave allowing you to pass through the Goma Range

Matchups.Flavourtext: Is this the lost head of Dullahan?
Bats?! In a cave?! No way! And you don't have Repels...
As you advance further in the obscurity, you hear sinister laments.
Is there anything left that's alive in this cave?
The way out is near. But before enjoying the sun again, you encounter a Djinni. Catch it!
Next time you visit a cave, you better bring some repels.
A few critters on the way to Bilibin.

Bilibin is a small town in the middle of Angara, just east of the Goma Range. At the town gate you see a tree trunk carved beautifully into the shape of a man. A sign in front tells the story of people being turned into trees. Weirdos.

In the middle of the town square, a golden statue dominates the small market. Lord McCoy, the Mayor who was passing by, shouts: 'Noice day, isnae it laddie? What yeh see is a statue of my wife'. What a cult of personality...

RewardTables.message: Oi, laddie! Yeh, you, adept, or what you might be. I have a task for ye. Some time ago me men cut down some trees. It mad the ole tree, Tret, mad and turned me men into wood themselves! Ever since we didnae touch a single branch of the ole spud, but now he accuses me men to clear too much woodland again! I swear it wasnae me men, I swear! So go tae the ole hag and tell him that it wasnae us who did it. None of me men can walk intae the woods and return. What areya standing there, rooted to the ground, go!
It wae a spirit, you say? Ye, yer kin an yer magic stuff, only bringing trouble all the time! Get lost before we burst up in flames or the ground unde yae feet rips open, be gone, I said!

Matchups.Flavourtext: What's that? A small gap between the statue and the ground reveals a little cave. Too bad, it doesn't lead anywhere except to a shelter for some shady people.

You explore more of the town. After some parcouring through the town you find another entrance to the Mayor's Warehouse cave. From here you can use your Psynergy to free the way. Which one do you use?
This is what Lord McCoy was hiding here... a Jupiter Djinn!
Onto the next shenanigans, before the guards figure out that you found the hideout.

Bilibin Cave.name: Bilibin Cave
Bilibin Cave.FlavourText: A small cave in the mountains north of Bilibin.

Matchups.Flavourtext: There is a small entrance to a cave. As you approach, you scare up some animals.
You enter the cave and quickly find yourself in a dead end. There seems to be a small ledge up there with a chest. If you jump high enough, you *might* reach it. Watch out, it's a bit gooey.
You hear an annoyed growl. It's a bear! In a cave... what did you expect?
You notice with the steam of your breath how the cave keeps getting colder and colder. What's up with that, huh?
You start to see how the cave freezes over, except for the spots with torches. Truly shows the balance of nature...
At last you see a bright light, marking the end of this cold cave. Oh wait! It *keeps* getting colder! And now you're being attacked by a pack of Wolfkins. Great.
Finally you see a light and snow.

Imil.name: Imil
Imil.FlavourText: Town of Imil, Cave in Imil

Matchups.Flavourtext: Approaching Imil, a gang of gnomes try to mug you...
You found a snowman at the entrance, and when you approached a monster attacked you from the inside of it!
Once in the town, some townsmen tell you that there are some issues with wild animals. Kind as you are, you gladly help them.

RewardTables.message: The villagers tell you how the light of the Mercury Lighthouse seems to weirdly flicker and how a white, ghostly apparition is seen at these times. They are too scared to check it out themselves, and they'd greatly reward you if you made sure that things are right.

Thank you for saving the lighthouse! So a spirit was draining the power of the lighthouse! And that Saturos... We heard he was dead? How come he was on top of the lighthouse? How scary... I hope you Adepts can protect us!'

Matchups.Flavourtext: Taken care of that business, people tell you of the epidemics they used to suffer from before the lighthouse was lit, while pointing towards the bright blue light.

You start to skate a bit on the frozen river, together with the other townfolk. Two little kids, calling themselves Justin and Megan ask you if you know a person called Mia. 'She is our hero!', they claim.

Not knowing said Mia and not wanting to upset them, you skate off, when you slip and crush into the frozen waterfall. There is a warm cave behind it, where a Mars djinni is warming two bears throughout their hibernation.
The town is friendly, but so cold. Time to get out of here!

Mercury Lighthouse.name: Mercury Lighthouse
Mercury Lighthouse.FlavourText: The mystical Mercury Lighthouse, home to the power of water.

Matchups.Flavourtext: As you step inside the entrance of Mercury Lighthouse, you are immediately accosted by a large humanoid lizard, adamant about blocking your way. You are provided with no option other than felling the reptile.
After besting the Lizard Man and delving further into the Lighthouse, it becomes clear that the place has been taken over by monsters. They don't seem too thrilled by your presence, either.

Navigating through halls and waterfalls, you find a chest, sitting right out in the open. The prospect of easy loot sounds absolutely lovely, but you also are suspicious of the chest. You must make a choice: Open it, or leave it?
Moving onward, you reach a large and magnificent statue, but some monsters seem to have beaten you here.
The statue blesses you with the gift to traverse across the water's surface. I think those bears may be jealous...
More lizard men turn the corner. Best to do away with them now, before they learn about their fallen comrade at the entrance.
These monsters are still incessant on ruining your sightseeing in the Lighthouse...
Some beasts in chains have you in their sights. Fortunately for you, they entered your sights first.
You check behind a waterfall, as you have the others you've passed. Behind this one happens to be a disgruntled Mercury Djinni.
More bears... anyone want a bearskin rug?
You come to one final waterfall, and with some prayers you reverse the flow of the water to carry to to the lighthouse aerie. Seems you have a farewell party as well.

Upon reaching the Aerie, you find the lighthouse beacon already lit, and none other than Saturos himself waiting. He seems to want to challenge your strength, and he likely won't take no for an answer.

RewardTables.message: A girl approaches you, she watched you battle the monster and you think you saw her back in the depths of Kolima. 'Oh young Adept! You have shown remarkable strength! I will let the guard allow you to pass over the draw bridge after Kolima. I'm in a hurry, are you on your way to Lama Temple? Let's meet there! Oh, sorry, I forgot to mention. My Name is Feizhi! Nice to meet you!'

You succesfully defeated Saturos, but instead of the warrior going to the ground, he appears well and healthy. Without a word the Proxian turns on the spot and swiftly runs to one of the side towers, floating even. You feel an ice cold breeze blowing towards the side tower, the light of the lighthouse begins to shine dimmer and brighter again. A huge, white beast, with long fur and shaped like a gigantic dog with one giant horn on in the middle of its head. In one continuous breath the creature is sucking in the air, the snow and the psynergy radiating from the lighthouse. Saturos clearly tries to attack the beast, but comes too late. The monster floats away and dissappears in the distance, near the shore of the icy sea. You try to remember the spot, this must be one of the spirits Hama was talking about!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Saturos? But that couldn't be. You heard the legends and he fell when fighting the Warriors of Vale. He was a misunderstood hero! Strange...

Lunpa.name: Lunpa
Lunpa.FlavourText: Lunpa, home of Dodonpa's family of thieves. It was known to be a fortress, but a big sign out front says 'Welcome to Lunpa! The strongest warriors may enter! Children and spectators, please talk to the guards!'

Matchups.Flavourtext: As you sneak in, you notice the monsters here seem more intelligent than the humans, as they quickly manage to spot you!
A guard is coming, quick, hide in the shadows and wait 'til he goes away!
You hear a group of henchmen talking about a yellow door, but there's no way to avoid them this time... neutralize them all before they can alert the whole fortress!
You're getting thirsty searching for the key to open that door... hey, this might quench you!
On a table you see three keys, grab one! Choose wisely, you only have the time to get one of them!
You keep going deeper into the stronghold. Uh oh... seems like it's the right way because you bump into another group of guards! No mercy for them!
Finally, Hammet's cell! You see the red door, but a huge monster keeps a globulous eye on it... you'll have to slay that oversized frog to save the merchant once and for all!
Let's get out where you came in. Better use that cloak again, though...

Kolima.name: Kolima
Kolima.FlavourText: Trees, trees and more trees. Quite the treey scenery. You wood not want to get lost here.

Matchups.Flavourtext: As you walk north along the coast of Angara, you are certain to pass this. What's this, the Queen of Rats or what?
In the distance you see some trees, but as you approach you realize that it's a town. It's surpringly calm and a bit overgrown. The perfect place for a Venus Djinni!
There was not much going in the town, so you head out. Further north, you spot a forest you want to check out.
Some bees swarming around, pretty typical in this kind of place.
Woops, something between the trees is moving. Totally normal, after all you've been rolling around logs all day.
You continue to advance deeper and deeper into the forest, take care you don't get lost. Unlike these guys, who were eaten by a troll.
Dusk is setting in. Either you find the way out now or try to survive the night.
The woods are getting clearer. Let's hope it's the end of the woods and not just another clearing.
A respectable first fight, yet you sigh upon recalling the great size of Tret.
First there was the forest, now there's this tree maze, too.
Since they were born, they've been stayin' alive
After some searching around a while, you find a room with a table of spiders playing cards, they immediately notice you, uh oh...
You take the first exit you see, which surprisingly leads to a Jupiter Djinni. However, he's in a bad mood so he wants to battle.
You return to the third floor and notice some shadows in the corner, What is it? CREEPER! Aw man...
As you are about to check the chest in the room, a troll enters the room
As you are about to check the chest AGAIN, more trolls enter the room. Someone likes to troll you.

You have had enough of this tree. You want to end this, so you jump down the middle of the tree. To your surprise, you found what you were looking for: Tret, asleep. He grumpily awakes. 'HROOOOM! You have disturbed my slumber. I sense an aura around you, you are an adept. Show me your strength!'

RewardTables.message: A girl approaches you, she watched you battle the monster and you think you saw her on top of the lighthouse you visited. 'Oh young Adept! You have shown remarkable strength! I will let the guard allow you to pass over the draw bridge after Kolima. I'm in a hurry, are you on your way to Lama Temple? Let's meet there! Oh, sorry, I forgot to mention. My Name is Feizhi! Nice to meet you!'

A bit out of breath, you look up. Tret is satisfied with your powers and accepts his loss. You tell him what McCoy has asked you to deliver. Before Tret could response, a loud roar raises your attention again, you come back to your senses, turn around and see a fierce beast. Not a bear, not a lion... something *else*. Something that wields an enormous axe. It must have witnessed your battle, so when it notices your glance, it runs off. It didn't hide far away, you track it down and just wait to catch your breath before you challenge it.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Was it a dream? Did you really just *punch* a tree? What a weird thought. Anyway, let's head home.

Fuchin Temple.name: Fuchin Temple
Fuchin Temple.FlavourText: Just a small trek away from Kolima Bridge awaits Fuchin Temple. Upon entrance, you see a waterfall and in front of it, a monk... perhaps he is guarding something?

Matchups.Flavourtext: The cave turns out to be writhing with monsters! They weren't joking about a test!
More beasts attack you from all directions, catching you off guard. From the ceiling, from the walls, from the water and the floor!
You find a gladiator struggling to go on. 'I'm too wimpy for this test! This cave is getting on my nerves. Hey, you look weak! Wanna fight?'
You make your way to a chest and open it, but hairy legs sprout out from under it. The chest is alive!
You spot a purple speck in the corner of your eye. Could it be? You finess your away around to it, and lo and behold, a Jupiter Djinn!
An intense battle with the Djinni left you fatigued. After witnessing your tired form, a bony group rush you.
The monks of the temple deem you worthy. They mentioned something about talking to monkeys in the forest? Whatever..

Mogall Forest.name: Mogall Forest
Mogall Forest.FlavourText: With the Fuchin monk's advice in mind, you enter the twisted sinister maze of a forest.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Centred in a small clearing is a tree stump, marking the entrance of the woods. Peering into its hollow, it is much deeper than you'd thought. Suddenly, a set of primal yellow eyes flicker up from the darkness and spot you.

After the battle with the furious ape, you proceed past the stump. Having heard quiet running from behind, you turn to see another ape coming at you. Turns out the first ape wasn't the only one in the trunk, and this time, there's a bunch!

A tiring battle with the apes left you facing the ground, panting hard. You notice tiny humanoid footsteps in the grass and follow it to a mystical area... perhaps elves exist? You barely have any time to take in your surroundings when you are attacked by a group of gnomes!
A puzzle of logs and stumps form a barricade in front of a small space between the woods, and chilling there, is a Venus Djinni! Disturbed, it attacks in a grumpy rage!
The loud battle with the Djinni seems to have upset the residents of the forest. You hurriedly try to go back to the clearing but your path is blocked by an unhappy bunch.
It is now apparent that you are an unwanted visitor in these woods. A loud roar from the trees beside you indicate the start of an ambush! All sorts of beasts hustle up to you in a swarm of madness.
After all of those battles and ambushes, you cannot wait to rest at the next town. Your hope, however, is crushed by an ape that stumbles in your path, trying to get a Tarantula out of its hair.
Thankfully, the end of the forest is in sight.

RewardTables.message: As you leave the forest, a soft breeze blows from the side. It smells of fresh of flowers and sweet. The source of the twirl is a shape floating in the air over a heather. The figure looks young, a girl with flowers plugged into her hair. You try to sneak up, but she notices you, visibly startled. She floats away, throwing you cautious looks over her shoulder until she went down into the midst of Mogall Forest. You start to feel the same breeze flowing through the endless woods. You must track her down!

Xian.name: Xian
Xian.FlavourText: Xian is a small town in the far east of Angara. It is the beginning of the silk road and is close to the fabled Lama Temple.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You finally leave the forest, what a relief!
Xian is small, but it looks cozy. It has a Kung Fu dojo, let's have a look!
Well *that* was underwhelming. And no one is wanting to fight you either, everyone is just looking for a certain Feizhi... Luckily, a little Djinni is playing in a puddle just outside!
Leaving the town didn't feel difficult, you really didn't get much out of it. In the wilds, however...! There's also not much to linger for.
On the waterside of a small headland you see a faint glow. You are attracted towards it, it makes you thirsty for a certain brew. The closer you get, the faster you walk, the more furious you become.
You nearly missed that djinn! You sense it's getting warmer and the air is getting more coarse, as if you were near a desert. In the distance you start to see a building, a temple even!

'Welcome! So you have made it'. A purple haired woman greets you. 'This is the one I was talking about! They are very talented!', a different, much younger purple haired woman claims. 'Very well. You must be very talented indeed, then. If you are ready to study under my ward, I may have a task a task or another for you.'

RewardTables.message: 'One year ago, the seal of alchemy was removed. In the process, the elemental forces have yet to find their balance again. The road ahead leads to Lamakan desert, a very dangerous place. Before you get my guidance to pass through, I need you to explore an old mining town, just to the north from here. An ancient culture used to live there, and now their antics often start to go wild and swirl up the town. Can you take care of this matter?

The creatures were powered by ancient Mercury Psynergy, remnants from the ancient culture. And you say a white spirit was dwelling in the energy? Oh no, this means trouble... Please, inform me if you see more of these occurances.

 Now though, you want to cross the Lamakan Desert. You'll need guidance, as the desert is full of heat and traps. An Adept needs to reveal an oasis for you to cool off in. Feizhi, do you think you have mastered Reveal yet? Would you be so kind and accompany {0} through that hellish place?

So you saw another spirit? One with two swords? The elements are out of balance more than I anticipated. The spirits are loose and mischievous, they will probably hide in places full of an element's psynergy and drain it. We need to seek them, but be careful!

'Oh my, you look like you walked right into a snowstorm. Oh! You found Moloch, the spirit of the north wind absorbing the power of Mercury in order to freeze over the world. Long ago, the world was one enormous lump of ice, and Weyard since experience eras of intense cold. But to think that Weyard should become a white wasteland yet again is inconceivable. Thank you for taking care of the matter, and let me know if more spirits are up for such mischievousness.'

'So Zagan, the demonic beast, claimed Weyard to be ruled by beasts, strengthened by alchemy? It is true that before us Humans, the animals were living where towns are now built. It came to a truce, but now the sudden eruption of alchemy is upsetting them...'

'Do you have news for me? Interesting. I felt the winds and aromatic breezes, I wasn't sure what to make of them. I had a feeling Flora, the flower spirit, was behind it. Before humans ruled the animals, and before that Weyard was filled with plants and flowers of all kinds and of incredible sizes. The plants won their reign over the cold wasteland that Weyard once was, but had to learn to live side by side with animals, and at last us humans. At last, maybe her powers can be used to bring balance between the dominant natural forces.'

Altin.name: Altin
Altin.FlavourText: The winding, water-logged mining caverns hide many secrets and many dangers. An Adept who is clever, cautious, and courageous just might be able to navigate the mine's perils and reap rich rewards.

Matchups.Flavourtext: At the outskirts of Altin, you are ambushed by mighty rat warriors with no tolerance for intruders!
Altin is partially flooded!  The townsfolk point you to the mine's entrance.  The first thing you see is a treasure chest!  But there's no such thing as free loot...
As you follow the railroad tracks deeper into the mine, the Halloween special assaults you!
A djinni is playing in the floodwaters here.  Light and refreshing!
A trail of ooze leads you onward.  Careful, this could be a sticky situation!
Beyond the ooze trail in, you find a dragon-like statue that spews water. It'd be kind of cute, if it wasn't attacking!
The floodwaters recede after you defeat the first one, but it seems they've banded together now!  Mo' Monsters, Mo' Problems.
The waters recede again, and a new path down is revealed. You reach the final chamber... Here comes the big one!

Lamakan Desert.name: Lamakan Desert
Lamakan Desert.FlavourText: The hottest desert in Weyard has no mercy. You will need Hamas clearance to cross it. Let's hope that you and Feizhi don't lose your path.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You're facing a wall of sand and heat. Don't forget to bring some water, perhaps write your last words...
'This desert has some oases, but a lot of them are just mirages. My powers are not very strong yet, so we need to pick carefully'
'Look, over there one of the antlions has come out of his hole!'
While the desert is hot, a lot have adapted to the environment.
Let's take a halt, and hopefully freshen up
Night is settling in, temperature falls and more creatures are coming out of their hideouts.
A sandstorm is whirling up, but wait, it's actually a monster!
Feizhi tries to cast Reveal on an Oasis spot but when she does, sensing her Jupiter psynergy, a djinni manifests itself and whirls up some sand.
'Oh no, it is really getting dark. Let's take one more break, we are close to the other side!'
This is the last cave... Let me channel my powers...' '***RROOOOAAAARRR!!!***' 'OH NO!'

RewardTables.message:
You defeated the giant monster, thank goodness! Now it's time to leave this hellish desert. Night is setting in, but it's hard to imagine that this place is going to get any nicer. All of a sudden, you hear a mischievous chuckle, spooky even. 'What's so funny?', Feizhi asks, but it was neither of the two of you. You turn around and in the distance, a few meters above the sand, a figure hovers. It's a girl, with the wings of an angel and two mighty blades in hands. It notices your glance, and flies off to the south.
'That must have been another spirit!', the Jupiter Adept declares. 'We need to inform Master Hama about it. Let's rest in Kalay and then we'll go back to the Lama Temple.'

Matchups.Flavourtext: The air around you appears to become cooler again. The mountains above you must shield off the hot climate from where your path leads to. At last you see some greens shining through the exit. You made it!

Kalay.name: Kalay
Kalay.FlavourText: The bustling seaside trading hub in the heart of Angara.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Sure, it's been days since you last had a warm meal, but still. Don't eat strange mushrooms...
Whoa! You nearly tripped. Who'd've thunk this little guy would be out here in the middle of nowhere?
Colosso hopefuls and local barflies who've all imbibed a bit too much and are looking for a fight.
Where there are merchants, there will be thieves.
A wild Mars Djinni appears! Seems this spitfire will need some convincing before it joins your team.
They don't allow you to have bees in here.
Want to set sail? These rowdy dockhands need you to prove you're not just another landlubber!
Seems you've disturbed some monsters! I wonder if they're guarding anything...
It's getting dark and in the distance you see the towers of Hammets palace. Time to head to the inn.

Gondowan Cave.name: Gondowan Cave
Gondowan Cave.FlavourText: The dank environment of Gondowan Cave makes for the perfect home for trolls and ogres alike. Having been unexplored for ages, who knows what else could be lurking about?

Matchups.Flavourtext: You enter the cave, where an Ogre is standing guard at the entrance. Calling out for his friends, he lashes out violently at you!
Ahead of you, the cave rumbles violently with the trampling of countless monsters. Before you'd even gotten anywhere, the first platoon of beasts arrive. Defend!
As you progress through the cave, you sight a doomsayer just as the next monster squad arrives right behind you.
The rumbling stops, and the cave is absolutely silent. You keep walking until you feel a faint hand on your shoulder. Ghosts!
Your path is blocked by a ring of doomsayers doing a ritual. Before your eyes, from the depths of the dark circle arises a demon. The doomsayer from earlier spots you and alarms the others. Fight!
A lone warrior is battling some monsters in preparation for colosso. He asks for a friendly sparring match. Sure!
The third and final beast gang arrive just as another demon emerges from the ritual and blocks the exit. Battle!
Finally you reach the end of the cave

Karagol Sea.name: Karagol Sea
Karagol Sea.FlavourText: The vast Karagol Sea! Its waters have claimed many an incautious sailor's life, and its monsters still more.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You stand at the rail of the ship, watching the Kalay Docks grow smaller. The sea breeze cools you and brings with it the smell of salt. As you contemplate the adventures that await you, someone approaches. A blue-haired fellow with the look of a warrior greets you, and you fall into easy conversation about this year's Colosso. When the warrior, Sean, learns that you know your way around the battlefield, he asks if you'd like to spar.

Sean is a gracious loser, and he thanks you for the chance to practice a bit more before the Colosso trials. You're then congratulated by a newcomer, who must have shown up while you were busy with your match. The red-haired man introduces himself as Sean's partner Ouranos and asks if you'd mind giving him a chance to try his strength as well.

Your defeat of both Sean and Ouranos seems to have gained you their respect. The three of you spend the afternoon swapping stories and cementing your new friendship. An interruption comes all too soon, however, with a cry from the crow's nest: 'Monsters sighted off the port side! All hands, prepare for boarders!'

After defeating the monsters, you and several other warriors on the ship meet with Kaja, one of the senior crew members. He tells you that monster attacks have been on the rise, so the crew will need your help to fend them off if everyone is to get to Tolbi safely. You and the rest of the warriors divide up the ship into which regions you'll defend, and only moments after you do so, another wave of monsters is spotted, this one fiercer than the last.

There's no time to rest. Despite your best efforts, some of the oarsmen have been injured by the swarm of monsters. A few of the warriors leave the deck to take up oars, lending their brawn to the cause. Passengers lend a hand as well, some less enthusiastically than others. Those of you who remain in the fight brace yourselves for the next attack.

'Land ho!' A frantic voice calls from the lookout. You spare a moment to squint at the horizon. Is that Tolbi already...? A mighty wave rises out of the Karagol, blocking the shore from view and sending you stumbling as the ship heaves. When you regain your footing, your stomach drops. There, lounging on the foredeck, tentacles wrapped around the bowsprit, sits a beast you thought mere legend - a Kraken.
Seasick and exhausted you lay foot on land again. What a trip.

Tolbi.name: Tolbi
Tolbi.FlavourText: On the south side of Karagol sea lies the huge city of Tolbi under the leadership, or *regime* as it's told, of Babi. What might be his secrets? The town is full of tourists, merchants, soldiers, ... It looks like they are getting ready for an event!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Aaah, the glorious city of Tolbi. You have heard a lot about it and you head straight to the famous fountain to try your luck. As you approach, you see that it is full of monsters...
While fighting those monsters, you saw a glowing shadow slipping by a house. You decide to follow it. Wait, a glowing shadow? That doesn't make any.. whooah, it's a Djinni
As you come back to the main square, you witness some thugs trying to steal a poor merchants cob of corn. You must step in.

Sigh.. The commotion has alarmed the guards. You just wanted to help, right? You have destroyed the whole market and burned down half a house, but noone could have seen that coming, right? ......Right?

The guards tell you that you are under arrest. They can't bring you there themselves, because they're injured too much, but give you the directions. On the way there you walk by some gladiators training. Let's say hello!
You're done with this city. Too big, too strange. You start exploring the outskirts.
The sky becomes overcast and something hard hits your head.
Before the weather gets worse, you take shelter in a nearby cave.
You realized that you are just walking around Karagol Sea. Let's head in the other direction.

As you cross over to the continent of Gondowan, you face a desert. Realizing that is going to be hot and that you won't be able to stop sweating, you wish you'd brought a change of clothes. Back to Tolbi, for now.

Colosso Trials.name: Colosso Trials
Colosso Trials.FlavourText: The Colosso tournament is the biggest event across Weyard. Warriors from all over the world are trying to compete in the tournament. Beat the trials, and you might have a shot as the finalist.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Round 1: You're up against Buford. He looks threatening in his black armor, yet you can feel his fear deep inside.
Round 2: Dekka must win the finals. Dekka. Dekka.
Round 3: Don't let Navampa's pink armor deceive you, because this warrior is much stronger than he looks like.. Good luck!
Round 4: Satrage, the fourth Warrior. You watched him meditate before battle. He is prepared for you.
Round 5: Galahads name incites the stories of the fabled knight of the round table, but by the clanking of Galahads armor, you *know* that he is more afraid of you, than you are of him.
Round 6: Azart trusts noone. You saw him in the audience of the previous battles, he watched you every move. Careful, and good luck.

Round 7: The final round of the trials. So far you have done well, but here comes your toughest opponent. Morgan, and his energy is ahead of him. He strikes powerfully, let's hope you can find his weakness.

Colosso Finals.name: Colosso Finals
Colosso Finals.FlavourText: You have made the finals! Contrary to previous years, you are asked to not just use your muscles, but also your head.

Matchups.Flavourtext: The Warriors of Vale once saved Weyard from dying. Who is the oldest valean Hero?
Your first fight in the finals, Azart. Good luck!
Which Item protects its wearer from the effects of the curse effect?
Satrage glances at you through the slits of his helmet. Good luck!
Which chute do you slide down from?
The final fight until you win the tournament! A fiery Navampa charges at you. Pull through!
What's that, another puzzle? Take a breath, think about this! You are facing four puppets dressed as Gladiators with nametags on them. Who is not competing in the tournament?
Oh no. The rumors were true! A fourth fight! An unknown warrior, masked and cloaked. You sense psynergy, watch out.

As you enter the Suhalla Desert, everything seems to be still aside from it feeling a little windy; sometimes a little too much. Rumors of Tornadoes sending people away have arisen in the desert, and it is up to you to solve this mystery and secure a route to Lalivero!
It seemed after using the Douse Drop on the Tornado, a Tornado Lizard appeared! It seems like these sandy devils have inhabited the desert!
After defeating the Lizard, you come to a junction; even with the winds blowing, monsters are teeming within the desert.
Another pair of Lizards! It seems there are quite a few of them.
Going further, the winds started to slow down, but in front was a chest! Upon opening it, it turned out to be a Mimic!
With a bit of treasure in your pockets, you start making your way towards the other end of the desert; Iodem also complains about sand in his pants with all the wind blowing it around.
More Tornado Lizards. Chances are, this is the last of them.
It seems as if the wind's picked up fiercely... and on top of that you're caught in a Tornado! Which Psynergy do you use?
Coming out into the open, it looks like the coast is clear, except... BOOM! A group of Stone Soldiers appeared!
After getting past all the explosions (without looking) a group of Magicore show up! Is this day going to get any worse?

Coming out into the open with the desert, you notice there's a gap you can't cross along with a large, giant tornado coming your way! Upon using Douse again, this lizard seems to be Green instead of Red! Chances are, it's stronger than most!
ARGH, sand. It's coarse and rough and gets everwhere. You can't wait to lay foot on some sweet sweet green grass again.

After backtracking from the Storm Lizard, you look back at the chasm you couldn't cross and use Reveal to find a hidden pillar to jump over on! However, there's something blinding over there...HOLY CRAP IT'S CHAD!...and he doesn't look like he's going down without a fight!

Phew...after the battle, it seemed it was actually the Djinni Flash just trying to make some friends! He really played rough...though, where does this cave go? On the other side, it's a massive, red Tornado! After casting douse, it looks like Storm Lizard's Grandpa isn't happy you did that...
A small narrow passage way makes travel tricky. It's not *that* hard, be the monsters in your way don't make it any easier.
You nearly slip but another ledge catches your fall. Luckily, otherwise you wouldn't have met this little guy!
At the foot of the Venus Lighthouse you start walking towards the small town Lalivero. The sun is burning down yet a cool breeze blows over from the ocean.
On the horizon Laliveros city wall start to appear. From the roadside, however, some monsters are trying to stop you from getting there.
Lalivero is small and cosy. The town is living from building the late Lord Babi's Lighthouse. Without the funds from Tolbi, there wouldn't have been much business.

The presence of guards is concerning, but the light of the close Venus Lighthouse surely has awakened the exploration lust of some monsters... The building site of the non-elemental lighthouse seems to be an especially active place.
From a distance you spot a shimmer, as if coming from a torch. Curiously, you check it out.
In the towns Inn you snap up stories from Faran about past stories. Lovely stories, but you need to move on.

Path of Gaia I.name: Path of Gaia I
Path of Gaia I.FlavourText: Venus, Earth or Gaia. Hama will teach you about the virtue of a Venus Adept.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome, Adept. I see you carry the power of Earth inside of you. I will teach you what it is like to be a true Venus Adept. Being a Venus Adept means combining all the qualities of a virtuous fighter. You are the force and you are the wall.'
You are the damage and you are the cure. So fight, fight like your life depends on it! Because it does...'
You are life and you are death. Let your enemies feel the power of the earth.'

You are the judge and the execution. Keep that in mind. Make your choices with Weyard in mind. You have done well! To prove yourself as a Venus Adept, you must conquer the Venus spirit inside of you.'

Very well, Adept! You have proven you can stand your ground. Next, I would like to show you the fantastic world of Weyard. Come to me again, once you have grown stronger and learned more about the secrets of Earth.'

Path of Gaia II.name: Path of Gaia II
Path of Gaia II.FlavourText: Hama will take you on a field lesson about the sandy history of Venus Adepts

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome back. I see you have grown a lot stronger. Let me show you the origins of the Venus Clan. Take my hand, quick!'
An ear ringing 'WHOOSH!' hollers through your ears and you feel warmth all over your body. As you opened your eyes, you find yourself surrounded by sand. In the distance, the peak of a lighthouse.
The Venus Clan once lived under the foot of the Venus Lighthouse. They built and protected it. You can see some remains of their culture buried in the sand.'

Jupiter stands opposed to Venus. They are natural counterparts. No, *not* natural enemies. However, you still need to keep in mind the balance of the elements. It was no accident the Venus Clan went extinct. The winds in the desert just grew too strong... they protected the lighthouse until their very end...'
Slaying that beast was a challenge. Hama chuckles slightly after seeing you exhausted. 'Haha, did you *feel* the power of the wind?'. Take a quick break to replenish your energies.
Then let me now reveal the last remains of the Venus Clan. In here, we will find the spirit of the great king and leader, well the *pharaoh* of the lost tribe. ***Ramses.***'

Do you now better understand the element of Earth? Yes? Here we witnessed death and devestation of an entire culture, buried under their own homeland. Continue your exploration throughout Weyard and visit me again when your are stronger. Next we will explore what *life* is capable of doing.'

Path of Gaia III.name: Path of Gaia III
Path of Gaia III.FlavourText: In some deep woods, Hama will show you the power that Venus exceeds, if left on her own.

Matchups.Flavourtext: I was expecting your arrival. With each of our meetings, the aura of your Psynergy is becoming stronger and stronger. Take my hand. We are heading into the depths of Kolima forest, impassable by normal means.
With a 'WHOOSH!' you teleport onto a small glade. The air is fresh and smells of pine needles and all kinds of flowers. You are surrounded by trees as far as the eye can see.

Those bees you just felled... they aren't evil monsters, they just try to protect their habitat. You also just tried to save your life, that is understandable. Life is a battle.
This area of the forest was practically never visited by mankind. However, it is said that some nature loathing elves are roaming the area.'
Let's head deeper into the woods. As you might have guessed, we are looking for something.
The thicket is getting thicker and more dense. We ought to be close. The plants are *not* happy that we are here.

Through the thicket another small glade appears. In its middle, an enormous creature, a spirit grazes peacefully. As it hears the rustle of the branchwood, it looks towards you. Suddenly the plants around you move aside and you can walk through with ease. The spirit seems to sense the power of venus flowing through your veins. It lets out a grunt, and takes and readies itself, clearly wanting to fight.

The spirit seems unharmed, visibly satisfied with the fight and willing to share its powers with you. 'Did you *see* that?', Hama shouts out with excitement. 'Being a Jupiter Adept, I never would have dreamt of getting so close to this magnificent creature. And you bested it on top of that! You clearly are a virtuous and strong Venus Adept. I will take you back to a safe place now. I wish you all the best, may Venus shine her light on you.'

Path of Magma I.name: Path of Magma I
Path of Magma I.FlavourText: Mars, Fire and Magma. Hama will teach you how to bridle your inner flame.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Hello, Adept of the Martian element. I can feel your energy from here! You might think that fire is all about force and destruction. You would be thinking wrong, in that case! Let me show you what it is like to be connected to Mars.'

You might be wondering what else there is, right? Fire itself causes destruction, is unstoppable and blind of rage. It can burn down whole continents if out of control. So you, young Mars Adept, must master that control over your element.'
Mars is warmth and light. A campfire at night, a torch in the dark. It can protect and provide safety. Let your fiery passion run, but be wise about it.'

Halt for a moment! See how more and more enemies are attracted by the light you create? Let them have their comfort. Rather than fighting them, show me what you have learned. Can you feel and challenge the Mars spirit inside of you?'

Well done, you have indeed understood. I would like to show you some of the Mars hotspots all over Weyard, but first you need to focus your energy on becoming stronger. Visit me again when you are ready!'

Path of Magma II.name: Path of Magma II
Path of Magma II.FlavourText: Hot places channel Mars psynergy, Hama will show you the spirits found there.

Matchups.Flavourtext: So you have come! Your progress is noticeable. Let me show you the hot power of Weyard.

With a quick 'Whoop!' Hama teleports the both of you. You find yourself in a dry heat, surrounding by sand and more sand. You are not sure if the heat is making you stronger or weaker, but it's an uncomfortable feeling, regardless. If you had only brought another set of clothes. 'Welcome to Lamakan! Believe it or not, but we are not far from my home, the Lama Temple. I see you feel the heat? Take it, bundle it, make the best of it. Here you can try the limits of your power!'

Let me cool off a bit.', the Jupiter Adept chuckles, while suddenly appearing soaking wet - and not from sweating. 'The desert is filled with small oases. A Jupiter Adept can reveal them! Hold still, you will find a lot of creatures coming closer to drink.'

Those oasis creatures give you quite the trouble, what? Naturally, they're water creatures! Keep in mind that as a Mars Adept you are still opposed to Mercury. These creatures right here have adapted very well to their surroundings. But the desert has more to offer.'

Salamanders are creatures we say are 'cold blooded'. They depend on the sun to regulate their inner temperature. You, on the other hand, are 'hot blooded'.
Yet, despite the natural fire you host, you have to be able to keep your composure at all times in order to take the good decision. This is a vital quality for a Mars Adept. But enough talk, fight these monsters with my advice in mind.'

Time has come for the real secret of this desert. You are going to face a spirit considered to be the king of the animals. Kirin is its name, and it is said to appear near people with a formidable destiny.
Prove Kirin that you have what it takes to face anything!'

Kirin stares at you intensely before roaring one last time and going away, as if the fight never happened. You look at Hama, who's nodding with a little smile. 'You have made some progress, but you'll need to become much stronger before your next lesson. Good luck, young Adept.'

Path of Magma III.name: Path of Magma III
Path of Magma III.FlavourText: Hama wants to show you the origins of Mars Adepts, but the location might surprise you.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Our last adventure was an interesting ride. This time we will try to find the roots of Mars Adepts. We need to go to a place... not exactly screaming of Mars Psynergy, but don't let it deceive you.

*WHOOP!*
You are surrounded by ice and mountains, in a corner a small cave. The horizon is lightened up by a faint, red glow. Hama was right, not exactly the place you expected. But you can clearly feel the heat and energy coming from deep below your feet.

Have you ever heard of the tribe of Prox? The are the guardians of the Mars Lighthouse, they form the Mars Clan. Although they appear humanoid, they are distinct in that they have draconic features. They have adapted well and have no trouble surviving the eternal cold, here in the north.'
Dragons are said to master Mars Psynergy. This is not quite true. Although the majority of dragons breath fire, dragons can come aligned to any of the four elements.'
This cave is full of fiery dragons, that's for sure. Watch them carefully, you can learn alot from them, like how to channel your inner flame most properly.'

From the depths of the cave you hear a mighty roar. 'Could this be?', the purple haired woman wonders cautiously. You go deeper into the cave and encounter a massive dragon. Something is different to the others, though. The dragon looks much older, much more magical. It shoots a fire ball just above your heads, but it clearly didn't intend to hit you. It stands up and is even more impressive than before. It looks at you, slightly demanding, slightly condescending. Ready your weapon!

The dragon lets out a roar, clearly satisfied with itself, but just as much with you. 'Do you know who you just met?', the Jupiter Adept said, also just as satisfied. 'Tiamat. The mother, no, *queen* of dragons. Bow. *Bow*, I said. She is supposedly one of the oldest creatures living on this planet, even older than Poseidon. This is a great honor.'

Path of Air I.name: Path of Air I
Path of Air I.FlavourText: Jupiter, Wind and Air. Hama will teach you how to master the swiftness, stealth and knowledge, which make a Jupiter Adept strong.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome, young Jupiter Adept. It has been a while since I have met a child of Anemos. Don't try to think that you will get a lighter treatment, though! Let me show you what it is like to be a Jupiter Adept.

The skill of a Jupiter Adept relies on one thing: Think fast. We need to be one step ahead of our opponent. Just being swifter than someone else is not always enough, we need to *know* what is going to happen.

Having this swiftness comes at a cost. That is, our lighter setup often costs us some physical prowess and endurance. But we are one with wind. We make our way by flowing around obstacles, even squeezing through the tighest gaps.
Now that I showed you the strengths of a Jupiter Adept, you need to show me what you've learned. You surely know what to expect.
Marvellous. Indeed you have the forces of the wind in your heart. Let me show you how high the wind can take us, all over Weyard. Prepare yourself first and get stronger, then meet me again.

Path of Air II.name: Path of Air II
Path of Air II.FlavourText: As a Jupiter Adept, you will need to know one of the most potent places.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome back! Congratluation, I nearly couldn't hear you approach. Your steps are silent and you are becoming swift like the wind. Come on, take my hand. Let me show you your origins.

You feel a silent '*swoosh*' and find yourself brighted by a large, purple sphere. You are being flooded by a massive amount of energy. Your hands and feet start to tingle, as if you were about to levitate. 'Welcome to the greatest source of Jupiter Psynergy, the Jupiter Lighthouse.'

This place was built a long time ago, by the brothers, sisters and children of Yegelos, the greatest hero of the Jupiter Clan.', the Jupiter Adept explains with an excited voice, unusual for the otherwise calm woman. 'Their tribe, the Anemos, left Weyard a long time ago. Legends say, they levitated a piece of this world which became our moon.'

The legend of Yegelos and Hoabna is taught as a reminder to keep conflicts between Adepts and non Adepts at bay. We have the responsibility to not repeat mistakes of the past. Knowledge of your ancestors and history is necessary to achieve that.

All Jupiter Adepts are said to be decendants of the Anemos. Nobody quite knows if this is true. Yet one thing is certain, the spirit of a glorious huntress of the Anemos lives on in this Lighthouse. Look behind you, do you see the statue of the archer over at the smaller aerie? It is made in her likeness. If we are lucky, we'll be able to meet her.
Do you sense that? She must be close, so be aware... She's a huntress after all, a master of stealth and surprise...

Atalanta puts her bow over her shoulder. She smiles at you invitingly and throws you an alluding wink, before she vanishes into thin air. 'Congratulations! You didn't let her surprise you. You cannot know history without knowing about both sides. We will explore the side of Yegelos' Rival, Hoabna, next. If you mastered your stealth and swiftness, visit me without me realizing.'

Path of Air III.name: Path of Air III
Path of Air III.FlavourText: Hama teaches you the history more about the history of Anemos, Yegelos and Hoabna.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You see Hama from afar. She doesn't seem to have noticed you yet, so in order to demonstrate your skills, you blow a little whirly tornado in her direction. You notice her lips forming a faint smile. 'Well done, young one. Are you ready to explore the past of Hoabna? Take my hand.'

With a short '*swoosh*' you teleport. You feel some arid heat, not uncomfortable, yet unusual with a constant breeze blowing through your hair. You open your eyes. You're on a mountain top made of orange sand stone. On the floor is a red and blue drawing. Far in the skies a gigantic bird is soaring in circles. 'This is the peak of Trial Road, a sacred place for the nearby Shamans.
The legend of Yegelos and Hoabna tells that the two heros had a run to the top and a fight on this very spot. Consequently, the year long war between the Shamans and the Anemos ended.

Mind your step, it's a long way down and enemies like to hide in the ground. Venus is the greatest weakness to us Jupiter Adepts, as those elements are opposites of one another. Yet, without earth we would have nothing to stand on.' You hear a loud screech from the huge bird in the skys. It has lost a lot of elevation, it's on a slow letdown.

The saying 'Kill two birds with one stone' bears misleading meaning. It makes the bird be afraid of the stone, yet without the stone the bird would need to fly with no break. It couldn't risk to roost or find bugs and seeds in the soil.

You hear the beats of wings and an ear shattering squeak and powerful energy warming your backside. You carefully turn around. You stand nose-to-beak with a gigantic bird. It is perfectly white with some golden feathers inbetween. It is nearly floating, barely touching the ground. You take a few steps back and ready your weapon.

The bird lost but one perfect, white feather. You pick it up in awe. Procne still has not touched the ground for one moment. She deeply looks into your eyes, and with one loud '***SCREEEEEEEEEE***' the spirit darts off vertically into the skies, where it disappears into the clouds.

Welcome, Adept. Water flows through your aura like blood through your veins. Let me show you what it is like to be a Mercury Adept. Water is steady as a flowing river. Unlike us Jupiter Adepts, Mercury is not rash in the least. Where Jupiter has knowledge, Mercury has wisdom.
Mercury Adepts are masters at healing, unbeaten by the less spiritual powers of other elements. Where life is, is water, and where water is, is life.
Water gets its power from its mass and omnipresence. Go on, flush away your enemies!
You are good! If you think you have what it takes to be a Mercury Adept, show me the power of Water that flows inside of you!

As you can see, the art and power of a Mercury Adept does not lie in its offensive strength. But don't judge wrongly. A Mercury Adept wins through consistency and duration. And in tight situations, the freezing power of ice can cause massive destruction. I am willing to show you more of the secrets and power of Mercury, however first you need to grow stronger. Come back to me, when you are ready.
'Greetings, young Adept. I see that your moves are starting to look like the flow of a river. Now is the time to talk about the intricate relations between Mercury and Mars.'
Hama teleports you on a beach, with a gigantic blue mountain a bit further in the land. 'Can you feel this place overflowing with Mercury Psynergy?' Hama asks. You nod.
'That being said, as this place is located in a tropical sea, Mars creatures can also thrive here.'
'A lot can be said about the way Mars and Mercury interract. Water can extinguish a fire, but at the same time, a fire may evaporate water. Or make ice thaw.'

'We cannot easily grasp how Mars and Mercury will behave in the nature. On a battlefield however, what determines which element comes out victorious depends on one thing: The will of their users. Be as impetuous as a torrent!'

'Finally, she appears... Nereid, the daughter of Poseidon. Her looks are not deceiving, she's much more peaceful than her father. She does know how to defend herself if needed though. Today she's simply gonna test you and see if you're worthy of her help whether you should need it.'

After the fight is over, Nereid starts giggling. You don't even have the time to feel insulted that you feel like if you were submerged in warm water. 'That looks like a success', Hama remarks. Nereid then puts her fan in front of her face while her turtle swims away, carrying her on its back.
'As usual, I'll send you back to where we came from. Train once again, and come back when your practice paid off. The next time, we're gonna try to meet one of the most impressive beings of the seven seas.'

Forest Den.name: Forest Den
Forest Den.FlavourText: The creatue hid in a small den, you need to challenge it before it cuts down the trees and threatens the serenity of Kolima.

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'You humans. Don't you see that the world is better off without your interactions? Let nature and alchemy run wild! The world belongs to the beasts and animals, there is no place for you!'
The beast charges at you. Watch out!

'You... you defeated me. You are no normal human. You are stronger than I expected! As if you controlled the psynergy... but that's impossible! Humans are destroying the world by killing every beast in their paths. But you, if you can tame the powers of Alchemy, I want to trust you... for now.'

Snowy Cavern.name: Snowy Cavern
Snowy Cavern.FlavourText: A snow covered cavern serves as the hideout for a certain creature...

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'Ice... good... Ice... preserve... Ice everywhere... means peace', the beast murmurs in a rumbly, deep voice.
The monster takes a big breath through its nostrils, opens its mouth and an onrush of cold air and snow blows into your face.
The beast is defeated. 'Ice... cold... Human.. strong... Gib... bellyrub... pls'

Bloomy Glade.name: Bloomy Glade
Bloomy Glade.FlavourText: In the middle of Mogall Forest, a small glade is filled with an aromatic breeze...

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'Who... who are you? How did you find me, how did you find me in this forest? An elf? Oh an Adept? A human with the power of psynergy? No, that can't be... it's nature, us, the kingdom of plants who must spread over Weyard again. The beasts took our place and ate our fruits, then humans came and trampled our saplings. NO! It must stop. I must rid the world of beings harming plants and blow everything not rooted to the ground off the world!'
Flora makes gestures with her hands. You feel vines grasping and wrapping around your legs, while the breeze emerging from the spirit becomes stronger.

'You stood your ground... and you showed strength greater than that of a usual human being... it must be from the psynergy inside of you. Plants must be protected and have a fair place in this world. Nature must be preserved, I trust you to take that task onto yourself.'
